sub_title: Head of Data Products at Miro | Experienced Director and Head of Data | ex-TripActions | Leading Business Intelligence, Data Engineering, and Data Science to Drive Business Impact
summary:
Experienced data professional with more than seventeen years of experience in the Data Engineering and Business Intelligence fields, possessing a background in finance. Since 2006 I've focused on introducing and developing organizational BI / DS competencies, having successfully led green field technical and organizational creation of data programs in gaming, retail, and travel. 

In these roles I have been building teams and leading strategy regarding data science, analytics, machine learning / AI, Business Intelligence, and data engineering since 2008. In this scope I have been responsible for defining organizational strategies regarding data and analytics, designing and hiring teams, architecting and implementing technology, and embedding analytics and data science capability across the company. As a manager I have successfully developed a number of juniors into leadership roles both within my own organization and outside and developed team cultures oriented on empathy, transparency, and high agency / empowerment of my team members.

As a result, the teams I've led have had enormous impact on the organisations they support. Some highlights:
* Creating the capabilities and supporting self-service analytics, unlocking >50% utilisation of self-service BI
* Developing best-in-class ML algorithms that have increased marketing conversion >50% and saved millions in costs per year in multiple domains (marketing, Customer Service)
* Designing and implementing data pipeline strategies to improve data reliability from <50% to 99%+
* Building best-in-class modern data solutions using technology like Snowflake, dbt, Tableau, Airflow, and Data Vault to create reliable, robust, easy to use data environments

organizations.name: European Network for Business and Industrial Statistics

projects.title: PHOENIX: New Data Warehouse at the Bijenkorf
projects.description:
Designed and built a new DWH infrastructure from the ground up to support omni-channel analytics and personalization fro eCommerce, Marketing, and Finance. Key components included:
- Fully cloud based, dynamically scaling systems infrastructure based on AWS
- Real time event tracking using Snowplow and custom code
- Near real time data integration into the data warehouse based on Data Vault 2.0 metholodogy
- Real time personalization generated using event and transactional data
- Web based reporting using Tableau

contributors.headline: Head of Data Products at Miro | Experienced Director and Head of Data | ex-TripActions | Leading Business Intelligence, Data Engineering, and Data Science to Drive Business Impact
Enterprise Solutions Architect @ Amazon Web Services
Co-Owner and Data Consultant at The Data Story & Marketing Quants

projects.title: Spil Event Tracker / User segmentation (2012 Oct - 2013 Feb)
projects.description:
The goal of this short term project was to build an intermediate solution to enable user segmentation on the most popular portals of SpilGames. As this solution was tightly coupled with data analytics we were also put in charge of creating a proof of concept for Spil's brand new event tracker system called SET.

Key responsibilities:

- Leading cross functional team consisting of five people + one joined from another team
- Taking full responsibilities of Product Owner including backlog preparation, providing weekly status update to our stakeholder
- Conducting project brainstorming meeting before kick-off
- Facilitating scrum meetings: grooming, retro, stand-up, root-cause analysis
- Resolving impediments gathered in retrospective or root-cause analysis meetings
- Being responsible for release planning and execution (Gant charts)

Challenges:

- Having to build everything up from scratch including both development and release processes
- Strict deadline (3 months / ~ 6 iterations), no room for big mistakes
- Lots of uncertainty and dependency

Achievements:

- Project finished on time with expected deliverables
- Rapid prototyping
- Failing fast and often resulting in stabilized velocity after 3 sprints
- Total of 19 releases of 6 different components in one sprint

projects.title: Spil Event Tracker
projects.description: Using "disco" map/reduce framework by Nokia, we were able to track pageviews and custom game-based events on a monthly user base of over 180 million of unique users distributed world wide, process it defining dimensions and metrics and finally store the processed data in our Vertica cluster. All automated.

contributors.headline: Head of Data Products at Miro | Experienced Director and Head of Data | ex-TripActions | Leading Business Intelligence, Data Engineering, and Data Science to Drive Business Impact
designing data platforms with cutting edge technologies
Senior Data & System Engineer at Alliander

profile_positions.description:
Sharing my experience from 15+ years of data leadership to work with companies on a variety of problems. Consulting in the areas of:
- Organizational hiring and development
- Technical strategy and architecture
- Technology selection and optimization
profile_positions.title: Independent Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Leading a teams of data and analytics engineers at Miro, responsible for supporting the entire organisation's data modelling and developing best practices and building capabilities in the areas of data quality, data observability, data warehousing, and data product development (product mindset, domain driven design of data assets)

Key achievements:
- Led the design and implementation of a data contract and observability solution that improved key pipeline reliability from <50% to 99%+
- Architected new approaches to improve event-based modelling, improving completeness of key user attributes from 70 to 98.5%
- Re-engineered the snowflake warehouse environment and led query optimization, reducing run-rate cost forecast by >40%
- Guided development of a new data architecture based on Data Vault 2.0 + Kimball data modelling to bring single source of truth to key dimensions and data sets
- Led re-architecture of integration approach oriented around the concept of "holistic data products" to use a consistent, library-driven architecture based on Python + Docker, reducing time of development by >50%
- Designed and facilitated modern data stack (dbt, snowflake) training across the entire analytics organization

Key technologies: Snowflake, Airflow, dbt, Looker, Python, docker, soda.io
profile_positions.title: Head of Data Products

profile_positions.description:
In this expansion of my prior role leading the company data team and strategy, I have also begun focusing on the integration of acquired companies, both data for reporting and analytics and the upskilling of subsidiary company data usage. Additional responsibilities include:
- Defining harmonization strategy and leading data integration into a common group data model, data warehouse, and reporting
- Implementation of standardized data feeds into key systems (ex Salesforce) and between group data warehouses
- Providing best practices, training, and enablement around data management to subsidiary organizations
- Working with CxO roles at both TripActions and subsidiary organizations on strategies to maximize data value creation at all levels to the organization
profile_positions.title: Senior Director of Data

profile_positions.description:
In this role, reporting directly to the CTO/Founder, I built the data competency and hired and led a globally distributed team of 30 analysts, engineers, and data scientists to build and run the company's data platform and strategy. The scope of my domain included:
- Infrastructure development and management
- Data engineering including data pipelines, tooling and CI/CD, and data platform
- Data architecture including warehousing, ETL, and reverse ETL
- Business intelligence, reporting, and analytics
- Machine learning services and data science
- Organizational training and development for data
- Analytics and decision support

Key Achievements:
- Led a greenfield development of a data strategy and technology platform, building a full BI stack (integration, data warehouse, BI, data science) based on a mixture of best-in-class modern tools like Snowflake, dbt, and Tableau
- Created a team organizational strategy and process structure which allowed the creation and management of a highly multicultural, diverse team with extremely high cohesion and satisfaction. All of our management is internally promoted
- Architected and led implementation of a highly distributed infrastructure of multi-region Snowflake, multi-region AWS, and Azure to allow best-in-class capabilities and data isolation and security
- Created and led a BI and organizational training strategy which took BI adoption from 5% of the organization to >70% and resulted in >95% of all data requests being self-served. Supported CEO/CxOs with weekly analytical cycles and recommendations
- Developed and led a data science strategy which allowed the team to go from zero to >20 models in production in under a year using best-in-class development, deployment, and management processes. Led to higher conversion, higher yield, and better customer satisfaction
- Led analytical partnership across the org to drive data-driven decision making
- Designed and implemented a data governance framework for SOC2 compliance
profile_positions.title: Director of Data

profile_positions.description: Description of role under Director, Data (title change to align to org standards, no change in scope or responsibility)
profile_positions.title: Head of Data

profile_positions.description:
Led a team of nine in the design, development, and deployment of the company's data and analytics strategy including architecture, data warehousing, reporting, CRM, and data science (including A/B testing / experimentation). My role was a mixture of company leadership, team leadership, and hands-on systems, machine learning, and BI development. Reported directly to the CTO
Key achievements:
-Led the design, development, and implementation of a fully automated, machine learning based content selection platform and fully automated email + CRM system that created a +57% increase in unique click through rate and a +224% increase in conversion
-Led the development of an algorithm to automatically adjust product markups based on expected price volatility and customer demand
-Implemented a self-service business intelligence platform and training curriculum to support >200 weekly active users with two FTE.
-Designed and built an advanced marketing ROI attribution model based on customer interaction paths to significantly improve budget allocation and achieve higher ROI/ROAS, translating to +5,5M EUR per year in net company profitability.
-Built a real-time recommendation system to support users with content recommendations within 100 ms
-Facilitated the integration of data and operations through the design and implementation of algorithm-backed decision support platforms, machine learning based forecasting models for planning, and automation on common operational tasks
- Designed and implemented data governance and management processes to support GDPR compliance

Primary technologies: Python, Apache Spark, R, Tableau, Tensorflow, Keras, MySQL, Vertica
profile_positions.title: Head of Data

profile_positions.description:
Leading a team of ten in the end-to-end data management and utilization at Spil, including business intelligence, data science, business analytics, big data, and data warehousing. Reported directly to the CFO

Key achievements include:
‣Developing and leading the company's business intelligence, big data, and predictive modeling strategies

‣Creating Spil's analytical/reporting data strategy and master data management (MDM) plan. Led the creation of >100 reports used by the company and over a dozen business partners.
 
‣Delivering near real time reporting across a variety of data sources to more than 50% of the organization daily via optimized ETL and big data pipelines

‣Development of the personalization platform and optimization of all on-site features using advanced predictive modeling, leading to feature performance increases >10% in engagement and churn metrics

‣Leading data scientists in developing predictive models to determine content classification and behavior prediction using advanced analytical techniques like neural nets, random forests, and regressions

‣Conducting weekly "Think Data!" sessions to introduce key data concepts, technical skills, and statistical concepts to more than 1/4 the company.

‣Driving development of front and back end development for reporting and analytics using Hadoop, Disco, Vertica, Pentaho, Tableau, and R

‣Member of the HP Vertica Customer Advisory Board
profile_positions.title: Director of Analytics

profile_positions.description:
Led a team of four responsible for the capture, processing, and interpretation of data for big data analytics, data science, and CRM, including:
‣ Front and back end development of the big data program
‣ Business analytics and financial business casing
‣ Predictive modeling and operational optimization using statistical modeling

Key Accomplishments:
‣Led the development and adoption of Spil's big data product, used to track >1.4 billion events daily

‣Led the initiative to segment users and content based on behavioral preferences, developing dynamic segmentation and recommendation models

‣Introduced reporting and analysis on top of Spil's big data platform, allowing customer-level analysis of 200 million users a month

‣Developed predictive modeling to estimate age and gender of 6 million anonymous users a day to enhance advertising effectiveness and value
profile_positions.title: Head of Analytics

profile_positions.description:
Initially hired to create email lists, I led the adoption of reporting, business analytics, and data warehousing at Spil. Introduced a number of new analytical techniques and rigor. Developed new insights into business operations by creating advanced analytical reporting.

Key accomplishments:
‣ Led the selection and deployment of the company's data warehouse and reporting platforms

‣ Introduced a number of analytical techniques like retention modeling, customer lifetime value modeling, and factor analysis to introduce data driven decision making to the organization

‣ Drove the adoption of data-driven decision making in the organization by creating workshops training sessions attended by more than 20% of the company

‣ Developed predictive modeling to create targeted email campaigns and traffic forecasts, increasing response rates significantly and accuracy to >95%
profile_positions.title: CRM Manager

profile_positions.description:
Directed a team in developing strategy and analysis to increase revenues from the customer base via cross-sell/up-sell across all channels, controlling revenue leakage, and reducing credits and adjustments. Leveraged SQL in multiple platforms and advanced analytics to create customer behavioral profiles and segmentation, employee performance analysis, and assess situations resulting in revenue loss/missed opportunity.

Technologies used included Oracle 9i, Teradata, Microsoft SQL Server, SAS Enterprise Guide, and R.
profile_positions.title: Senior Manager, Business Analysis

profile_positions.description:
Led a team in data and financial analysis using SQL and SAS to produce insights and organizational guidance for T-Mobile USA Customer Service.

Key Tasks:
-Finance lead for Self-Service/Automation 2011-2014 roadmap (strategic program management program in partnership with operations VPs)
-Development and guidance of Customer Service cross-sell/upsell program, including reporting, compensation, opportunity analysis, offer creation, and ongoing operations support 
-Customer behavioral and operational performance analytics
-Classification modeling of call root causes
-Customer value/risk segmentation for routing purposes
profile_positions.title: Finance Manager

profile_positions.description:
Provided analysis of Customer Service via SQL development, data analysis, and financial modelling, working as an internal consultant to Operational Vice Presidents. Analytical lead for CS metrics planning.

Key Tasks:
-Development of multivariate customer calling models to assess market factors and impacts of product launches on call volumes
-Bonus program and KPI development to drive improvements in AHT, customer experience, and call resolution
-Business case development and evaluation
-Dashboard creation and performance evaluation
profile_positions.title: Senior Financial Analyst

profile_positions.description: Processed compensation and adjustments for all internet dealers and value added reseller partners for T-Mobile; provided analysis and dispute reconciliation for commission issues; developed a GUI using SQL and VBA for reconciliations which accelerated processing by 40%+; created reporting dashboards and analysis for dealer visits
profile_positions.title: Commissions Specialist
